glossentry.glossdef: S8 Home Routing is a roaming model for VoLTE where S8 is a standard interface between Serving Gateway and Packet Data Network.
Self Care in CE.
Creation of additional pod instances (scale out) as required to handle the offered load, or deletion of pod instances (scale in) if the offered load can be handled with fewer.

Signaling Connection Control Part is a network layer protocol that provides extended routing, flow control, segmentation, connection-orientation, and error correction facilities in various signaling system telecommunications networks.
Session Charging Unit Reservation is a session based charging event which requires multiple transactions between the CTF and OCF to report the units that are currently used.

Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) is a reliable data transfer protocol in the transport layer that operates over IP, like TCP, to transport telecommunication signaling messages between peers.
Service Data Flow describes a flow of packets which represent a service being delivered to a subscriber, such as a flow of voice packets associated with a call
Session Description Protocol is a format that defines the guidelines for exchange of media communications between two endpoints.

A service mesh is a layer of communication infrastructure that efficiently handles the service discovery, traffic management, security authentication, and authorization for container-based applications.
Service model is responsible for managing the charging and rating entities in the NCC database such as bundles, tariffs and buckets.
Is the association of a particular recharge cards with a specific manufacturer.
The organization that manages the services offered to the end users and uses the network infrastructure provided by the network provider.
Session management is responsible for creating, updating and deleting the call sessions from memory.
Serving GPRS Support Node is the main component of the GPRS network that handles the packet switched data in a network.

A singleton pod is deployed as a single instance. If that instance fails, a new replacement pod will be automatically spun up by Kubernetes. There is always one instance, as this pod type is not horizontally scalable.
Session Initiation Protocol is a signaling communications protocol used for controlling multimedia communication sessions.
Spending Limit is the maximum credit amount that the subscriber can spend on various services.
Spending Limit Answer is a command sent to the OCS from the PCRF as part of the Initial or Inglosstermediate Spending Limit Report Request procedure.
Spending Limit Request is a command sent to the OCS by the PCRF as part of the Initial or Inglosstermediate Spending Limit Report Request procedure.

The Service Manager operates in active/active mode and uses database cross-site replication to keep data synchronized between the two SMs. SM serves as the entry point into the NCC deployment for all GUI and APIs such as provisioning, self-care, mobile-app interactions, etc. SM is the provisioning application of Nokia Converged Charging (NCC). SM is a centralized application server that supports provisioning, validation, and distribution of system configuration, service, and operator data for Managed Elements (MEs).

The centralized Service Manager CNF manages all the MEs in the network. SM is a highly scalable front-end access to the network of NCC CNFs. It hosts all GUI, provisioning, and external API access. SM runs in an active- active deployment with data replication between the SMs.
The Service Manager graphical user interface.

The Service Manager serves as the entry point into the NCC deployment for all APIs such as provisioning, self-care, mobile-app interactions, etc. Nokia Converged Charging (NCC) hosts application programming interfaces (APIs) on its Service Manager (SM) component. These APIs are typically REST-based and support a variety of users. In all of these use cases, the same REST API layer in SM is invoked. This layer provides the business logic to authorize the user, validate data change requests (including against other data already in the DB), index, mediate, and persist appropriate portions of the data in the SM database.

Service Management Function is an attribute of the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) network functional model that provisions and distributes the databases to Service Control Function (SCF) equipment.

Short Message Service is a text messaging service of the phone, web, or mobile communication systems that uses standardized communications protocols that enables the exchange of short text messages between fixed line or mobile phone devices.
Short Message Service Center is a network element in the mobile telephone network to store, forward, convert, and deliver SMS.
Spending-Status Notification Answer command is sent to the OCS for the spending limit report procedure.

Spending-Status Notification Request command is sent to the OCS from the PCRF as part of the Spending Limit Report procedure. The SNR is sent by the Sy interface when the threshold defined for a subscriber account is reached.
Simple Object Access Protocol is a standard communication protocol that enables systems to communicate through HTTP and XML.
Source Contexts provide a scope to rules that can be applied in given contexts.
Subscriber Profile Repository stores dynamic subscriber information such as policy, quota, and rules.
Session termination Answer command requires the session state which is associated with the session ID to be freed.
Session termination Request command is sent by the PCRF to the OCS as part of the Final Spending Limit Report Request process.
Subscriber is the term that is used to refer to a person or a group having an account with a mobile network carrier.
The subscriber model is responsible for managing the subscriber related information in the NCC database.
Subscriber Permanent Identifier is a global unique identifier that is allocated to all the subscribers in the 5G network.
The Sy Interface reference point is located between the OCS and Policy and Charging Rules Function (PCRF). The Sy Interface transfers subscriber spending related information to PCRF.
